info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 7:38PM CDT until May 3 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes.
Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting East Baton Rouge, Pointe Coupee and West Feliciana Parishes.
Mississippi River At Donaldsonville affecting Ascension Parish.
For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Donaldsonville.
* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Saturday, May 03.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 25.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon to a crest of 29.5 feet Saturday, April 26. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, May 03. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY, MAY 03
